intro: Gilia leptantha subsp. pinetorum, commonly known as the Sierra gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has hairy, slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
